U.S. Policy for Domination Flayed
articles.content:
U.S. Policy for Domination Flayed 
   Pyongyang, June 2 (KCNA) -- The Western Regional Federation of Koreans in the United States reportedly held a monthly meeting denouncing the U.S. policy for domination on May 21.
 Speakers at the meeting accused the U.S. imperialist forces of having pursued a policy aimed at destroying those countries attempting to follow a policy for welfare or a socialist policy and aspiring after sovereignty and independence at their cradle.    
 When finding it hard to suppress the independent forces, the forces for social welfare of other countries by dint of this policy, the U.S. resorted to such dangerous act as igniting a war by mobilizing the anti-national forces subservient to the imperialist forces, they noted.

articles.content:
S. Korean Visiting Group Arrives
   Pyongyang, June 2 (KCNA) -- A visiting group of south Korea's Foundation for the South-North Economic and Cultural Cooperation led by General Director Im Jong Sok who is assemblyman from the Uri Party arrived here today.
 It was greeted at the airport by Pak Kyong Chol, vice-chairman of the National Reconciliation Council, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets German Lawmakers
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets German Lawmakers
   Pyongyang, June 2 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with Members of the German Bundestag Johannes Plug and Petra Ernstberger, parliamentary secretary of the Social-Democratic Party group in Bundestag, and their party at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Friday.
 On hand were Chairman of the Korea-Germany Friendship Parliamentary Group Ri Jong Hyok and Ryom In Yun, deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, and German Ambassador to the DPRK Friedrich Ludwig Loehr.
